description: Write n in base 3 then rotate left one place.
comments: A={a(n)} is self-similar in the sense that the subsequence remaining after deleting the first occurrence of each integer is identical to the original sequence A (Kimberling's "upper-trimming" operation).Fixed points of the transform are listed in A048328. _Paolo P. Lava_, Mar 02 2015
mathematica: Table[ FromDigits[ RotateLeft[ IntegerDigits[n, 3]], 3], {n, 1, 76}] - _Zerinvary Lajos_, Mar 25 2007
author: _John W. Layman_ and Anthony C. Hill (hilla(AT)hotmail.com)
